alert.note: Alert for Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Mathews; Middlesex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 1:53PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Gloucester, southeastern King and Queen, south central Middlesex and northwestern Mathews Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 153 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gloucester Courthouse, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Gloucester Courthouse around 205 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Dutton, Beulah, Cobbs Creek, Harcum, Gressit, Pinero, Pampa, Ware Neck, Fort Nonsense and Ark. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Mathews; Middlesex
